Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on inalienable human rights, particularly freedom of speech.
The government should not control speech through threats of punishment.
Determining misinformation and disinformation requires an impossible level of omniscience and expertise.
The legislation could lead to tyranny and fraudulent authority.
Exemptions for certain entities, including the government, undermine equality before the law.
The bill could be applied to private messaging, threatening personal communications.
Existing statutes already address harm caused by communication.
The bill could stifle societal development and growth.
The government lacks the lawful authority to enact this bill under the Commonwealth Constitution.
Notable Quotes: To restrict in any way the free expression, discussion and interaction of ideas and opinions is to restrict the development of mankind.
ACMA is not God nor an expert with the final say on all matters concerning the human situation.
This Bill protects various 'exempt' entities’, including governments’, misbehaviour from any liability, censorship or penalty to the detriment of the people.
It is MY WILL that this Bill shall be rejected in total. I do not consent to this Bill becoming an Act in any form.
